page.title: 20Grafton Hunt and Paulerspury
page.content:
The Grafton Hunt kennels, built in 1890, are in Paulerspury and house 60 hounds and 12 horses. The puppies are born in the summer and when weaned are sent to farms to be looked after until they are 12 months old. The following winter they go out with the hunt for the first time. The hounds are fed on raw meat which costs about 8 pounds per hound per week.
CREDITS Data collection was by the children of Paulerspury and Whittlebury schools assisted by staff, parents and friends. The photographs were taken by a Whittlebury parent, Mr M. Southerden, and a Paulerspury teacher, John Marshall.
